newsitem.title: UK: North Sea crudes steady in tight November supply.
newsitem.headline: North Sea crudes steady in tight November supply.

text.p: North Sea crudes were mostly steady at the lower levels in quiet trade on Friday.
Traders said, the market had largely shrugged off news of higher December loading programmes with thinner supply of late November cargoes supporting the wet Brent market.
Wet Brent traded at 48 cents under December or the equivalent of 16 cents under January and at dated Brent +4 cents. Both levels were around unchanged from previous trade.
Traders said most of the remaining Nov Brent was held by Statoil who added a further two cargoes to their inventory today and are expected to take the barrels transatlantic.

Supplies of other North Sea grades were also limited with the remianing Statfjord cargoes sold at dated Brent +15 cents and +18 cents. The last remaining Oseberg having sold late on Thursday at a relatively healthy Dated Brent plus 23 cents and traders saw only Ekofisk cargoes left for sale in November.
A December 8-10 loading Forties cargo achieved a slightly firmer rate of Dated Brent +20 cents
Next week's CFDs steadied a little in late business to Jan Brent flat with a Nov 18-22/25-29 roll done at +3 cents.
